alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Laramie County through 600 PM MDT... At 528 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Whitaker, or 26 miles north of Cheyenne, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Laramie County. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 33 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
